page.title: 06Pig Farming
page.content: West Town Farm, a small 2 acre farm, has been run by one family for 48 years and has been known by this name for 14 years. 4 people work full-time and there are 2 part-timers. They keep 3,000 pigs including 300 sows and 7 boars which are fed a mixture of barley, wheat and fishmeal. A sow has its first litter at about 11 months and she usually has 2-3 litters in a year. There are 8-19 in a litter, the average being 10. 100 piglets are kept for breeding but most are sent for slaughter at 20 weeks of age, when they weigh about 180 lbs. They fetch about Â£60. There is also a "pick your own" area growing goosberries,blackcurrants and raspberries.
